Text:
A Halloween event organized by Mitsugoshi—Despite
its popularity, the event faces severe staff shortages.
As a result, Eta and Delta from the Seven Shadows
are dispatched to the branch.

During the Halloween event, we'll be handing out
ribbons exclusively to children who have made
purchases at Mitsugoshi-affiliated stores.

These ribbons come in three colors: red, blue, and
yellow, with each corresponding to the amount spent.
We would like you to give sweets to the children
based on the color of their ribbons.

When children approach, they will say, "Trick or
treat!" If a child's ribbon is red, please offer them
both cookies and candy; for blue ribbons, just
cookies; and for yellow ribbons, just candy.
Hey, vampire lady! Trick or treat!
...A blue ribbon. Cookies... Here you go.

I'm the strongest knight in the kingdom! I'll get
you, vampire!
...No ribbon... Unrelated to the event...

*gasp* She vanished! Where did she go?!
Let's find her!
*yawn*

Quit yawning, Eta, and get busy handing out the
sweets!
No need to rush, so long as we meet the quota...

Hmph! I can't play until we're done! So pick up the
pace! Like this!

...And she's gone... I don't know... It all feels
kind of...inefficient...

Eta grumbles under her breath as she continues
distributing sweets to the children based on the
color of their ribbons. Several hours later...

Eta is back at her lab in the Shadow Garden's
hideout...

Hey, what's going on? You rushed back here and just
started working on this secret weapon of yours...
Could you explain it to me in more detail?

I gave you permission to develop it, but just
remember you're on a tight budget, alright?
*sigh* You're not even listening.

Handing out sweets based on ribbon color might sound
straightforward, but it is actually quite demanding
in a setting centered around children.

(Being chased by kids, passing out sweets by hand,
constantly checking ribbon colors... It's all such a
hassle.)

(...Delta also managed to mess up the colors and
types...)

Faced with various complications at the branch, Eta
has returned to her lab to solve these issues.

(That groundbreaking secret weapon...just might
work...)
A vending machine?

That's right. An automatic vending machine, to be
more precise.

A vendor... So it sells something? And what do you
mean by automatic?
Hold on a second. I'll draw it for you.
...Alright, something like this.
What is this?

You insert money and press a button linked to a
specific product. Then, the product is automatically
dispensed.

You can install them anywhere you want so long as you
implement measures to prevent money or product theft.

...With this vending machine, you wouldn't need to
worry about hunger or thirst?
It can satisfy...hunger and thirst?
I guess.
A vending machine...

Thinking back to the day she received the Shadow
Wisdom from Cid, Eta starts slowly drawing up the
blueprints.

(Applying the concept of the vending machine...
Instead of selling anything, it would just dispense
sweets... So I guess that makes it an automatic
dispenser.)

(We shouldn't keep the children waiting, so it'll
need a mechanism that can instantly identify the
color of their ribbons...)

(Exclude anyone who's not a child by using a camera
for identification. Add a color recognition function
to that, and...)
Whew... I've finished Prototype 1.

Examining her hastily assembled automatic dispenser,
Eta wears a satisfied expression as she wipes the
sweat from her forehead.

With this, we can efficiently distribute sweets.
Delta won't make mistakes either...
Perfect... It just goes to show that...

...Master Shadow is incredible. I couldn't have come
up with this without his Shadow Wisdom...

Eta's expression takes on a dreamy quality, but she
quickly snaps back into action.

I should head back to Delta and the others. Oh...
right... I still need to come up with a name for this
automatic dispenser... I guess I can think of one on
the way there.

More importantly...I should add something that
clearly identifies it as belonging to Mitsugoshi...

Oh, maybe like a logo. Childhood memories tend to
stick with you... For the future customers of
Mitsugoshi... It's genius..

While the development costs did end up slightly
exceeding the initial budget, in the grand scheme of
things, we'll more than make up the losses... Gamma
shouldn't have too much to complain about...

And with the potential application of this system,
Mitsugoshi's products could be placed in various
locations... Who knows? Gamma might even
increase my research budget down the line!
Heheheh...

Smiling at her own flawless plan, Eta adds the final
touches to the automatic dispenser...
